Input, Output, and Settings

Input, Output, and Settings

These functions are responsible for reading in all model configurations (passed by config file or commandline), administrating them during a run, and printing any output.

constants.jl

This file defines constants that are needed for calculations involving the metabolic theory of ecology.

Currently includes boltz (the Boltzmann constant) and act (the activation energy).

defaults.jl

GeMM.defaultSettings — Method.
defaultSettings()

Defines the list of configuration variables and returns their default values in a dict.

source

input.jl

GeMM.getsettings — Method.
getsettings()

Combines all configuration options to produce a single settings dict. Order of precedence: commandline parameters - config file - default values

source
GeMM.readmapfile — Method.
readmapfile(mapfilename, settings)

Parse a map file and return the number of timesteps this map is to be used for (first line of the file) and the patch definitions. The latter is used by createworld and updateworld!.

source
GeMM.basicparser — Method.
basicparser(filename)

Do elementary parsing on a config or map file.

Reads in the file, strips whole-line and inline comments and separates lines by whitespace. Returns a 2d array representing the tokens in each line.

source
GeMM.parsecommandline — Method.
parsecommandline()

Certain parameters can be set via the commandline.

source
GeMM.parseconfig — Method.
parseconfig(filename)

Parse a configuration file and return a settings dict.

The config syntax is very simple: each line consists of a parameter name and a value (unquoted), e.g. nniches 2. # is the comment character.

source

output.jl

GeMM.setupdatadir — Method.
setupdatadir(dir)

Creates the output directory and copies relevant files into it. If the output directory already includes files, create a new directory by appending a counter.

source
GeMM.writedata — Method.
writedata(world, settings, timestep)

Writes simulation output from world to separate table and fasta files. (Which data is recorded depends on the settings.) timestep and setting information is used for file name creation.

source
GeMM.dumpinds — Function.
dumpinds(world, io, sep)

Output all data of individuals in world as table to io. Columns are separated by sep. WARNING: this produces very large files!

source
GeMM.makefasta — Function.
makefasta(world, settings, io, onlyisland, sep)

Record the genome of every individual currently alive to the given IO stream. WARNING: this produces very large files!

source
GeMM.printheader — Function.
printheader(settings, io, sep)

Print a list of property names to the given IO stream. This is a helper function for dumpinds.

source
GeMM.printpopheader — Method.
printpopheader(io)

Print a list of property names to the given IO stream. This is a helper function for printpopstats.

source
GeMM.printpopstats — Method.
printpopstats(io, world, settings, timestep)

Record statistical information (maximum, minimum, median, standard deviation) for a range of individual properties, as seen over the whole world population.

source
GeMM.recordlineages — Method.
recordlineages(w)

Save the abundance of each lineage per patch.

source
GeMM.recordstatistics — Method.
recordstatistics(w)

Write out world properties to the log file for later analysis.

source
GeMM.simlog — Function.
simlog(msg, settings, category)

Write a log message to STDOUT/STDERR and the specified logfile (if logging is turned on in the settings).

Categories: d (debug), i (information, default), w (warn), e (error)

source
GeMM.writesettings — Method.
writesettings(settings)

Record the settings actually used for a simulation run (cf. getsettings). Creates a config file that can be used for future replicate runs. Also records a time stamp and the current git commit.

source
